comments:
I have Windows 2000, JDK 1.4.0_01, Eclipse 2.1 M5 build.

For no apparent reason, the package explorer seems to lose its mind for 
particular sections of the heirarchy. I am able to expand and collapse the tree 
and interact with it just fine.  But certain sections become invisible and the 
only remedy is to restart eclipse.

Please see the attached image.

This has happend twice now, and I have no idea why.

Created an attachment (id=3508)
View of the problem.

Just wanted to point out that this probably has nothing to do with the fact 
that there where compile errors at the time (it happended before when there 
were not).

Scott, 

can you please attach Eclipse's log file. You can find it in the .metadata 
directory of the workspace directory. I think for some reason (unexpected 
exception) the text and icon isn't rendered.

The interesting exeption is

The NPE avoids setting the correct image and text for the tree item, hence the 
appear empty.

Carboning Nick since I think the tree viewer should protect itself againt 
runtime exception in updateItem.

The viewers should already be protecting themselves.
If they weren't, the refresh wouldn't have continued on to the next item and 
only the first would be blank.
Eduardo, please verify.

The view is already protected. The ideia is the Eclipse keeps running but the 
exception will be logged since it is an error in the view.

Closing since the NPE is already fixed.
